keywords.desc: A piece of tech scrap.
A traditional firearm that uses gunpowder to fire bullets. cant go wrong with this one.
A weapon that uses energy to fire.
A melee weapon that has sharpened edges.
A piece of equipment that protects the head.
A piece of equipment that protects the upper body.
A piece of equipment that protects the lower body.
A piece of equipment that protects the feet.
A cyberpunk term for cybernetic implants, if you don't know what it is please check google
Use to recover small amount of health
Use to recover moderate amount of health
Used to calibrate equipments
Use to decrease chance of equipment destruction by ${percent}% when calibration failed
Use to decrease chance of equipment destruction by ${percent}% when calibration failed
Use to decrease chance of equipment destruction by ${percent}% when calibration failed
Use during calibration to increase chance of success by ${percent}%
Use to reset a uncommon item with new traits by chance
Use to reset a rare item with new traits by chance
Use to reset a unique item with new traits by chance
Use to reset a epic item with new traits by chance
Use to reset a ${tier} item with new random prefixes
Use to upgrade an common item to uncommon tier
Use to upgrade an uncommon item to rare tier
Use to upgrade an rare item to unique tier
Use to upgrade an unique item to epic tier
Use to upgrade an ${fromTier} item to ${toTier}
Use to level up an common item to its next level
Use to level up an uncommon item to its next level
Use to level up an rare item to its next level
Use to level up an unique item to its next level
Use to level up an epic item to its next level
you can use this item to level up an ${tier} item to its next level
Use to identify unknown traits in a item
Use to inject an additional prefix into a item, please note that if you re-roll the prefixes after using this item, the effect will be nullified.
Use to enter a dungeon
Use this token to meet and recruit new mercenaries in Red Bar

Neural Upgrade Augmenter is a cutting-edge implant that enables users to break past their mental limitations and reach untold levels of cognitive enhancement. With the ability to exceed typical neural barriers, users can unlock new levels of insight, creativity, and physical performance.
An item name, a cybernetic implant that can enhance players' abilities
EuroDollar is a widely accepted currency in the continent, used for everyday purchases and transactions.
NetCoin is a digital currency mainly used in black market transactions. It is untraceable and can be used to purchase illegal goods and services.
A fictional currency name in the game, translate to a suitable name in your language
Universal level up token for equipments, use to increase the level of an equipment
Universal calibration token for equipments, use to improve equipments
Use to contribute to gang territory control
Use to contribute to gang maintenance
An item name used to repair broken equipment
A traditional dish of braised pork belly and rice.
A staple food of the continent.
Slice of ordinary synthetic pork
a rare delicacy made from real wheat flour, smuggled by rebels who oppose the synthetic food industry.
A cheap and addictive food made from synthetic meat and chemicals. Popular among lowlifes and hackers who need a quick energy boost.
A medium sized vibrant fish, it's highly sought after for its psychedelic properties when consumed.
A synthetic egg, used in many dishes.
A basic ingredient used in baking.
A synthetic milk, used in many dishes.
A synthetic turkey meat, can be used to craft turkey dinner.
A traditional dish made from turkey meat, rice.
A traditional dish made from eggs boiled in tea, soy sauce, and spices.
A dessert made from pumpkin, eggs, and milk.
A large orange fruit, used in many dishes.
A sweet dessert made from flour, sugar, and eggs.
A traditional Japanese dish made from raw fish and rice.
Used to re-roll quest reward.
A traditional Indonesian dish made from skewered meat and rice.

Neuroblockers were developed to counteract the negative effects that cybernetic implants had on the human body. By suppressing these effects, people were able to use these implants with reduced suffering from physical or mental issues
A common container that contains a random item.
A uncommon container that contains random items.
A rare container that contains random items.
A unique container that contains random items.
A key that can be used to unlock a ${containerName}.
Collect ${amount} of these to create a ${keyName} that can be used to unlock a ${containerName}.
A key that can be used to unlock a ${containerName}.
Collect ${amount} of these to create a ${keyName} that can be used to unlock a ${containerName}.
A key that can be used to unlock a ${containerName}.
Collect ${amount} of these to create a ${keyName} that can be used to unlock a ${containerName}.
Special reward container obtained from clearing hard or above difficulty strongholds in locations
Event container that contains various rewards, can only be unlocked during December.
A piece of medical technology that can be used to craft
A cutting-edge cyberpunk device that serves as a key to unlock high-security doors in the dystopian strongholds, revealing valuable loot and hidden rewards.
A token can be used to trade with the merchants in strongholds.

keywords.trans: Ativador de Buff de Aumento de Loot
keywords.desc: Deploy this buff in stronghold lobby to increase loot amount for all strongholds created by your gang members for ${minutes} minutes

keywords.trans: Ativador de Buff de Aumento de Defesa
keywords.desc: Deploy this buff in stronghold lobby to increase defense for all players in strongholds created by your gang members for ${minutes} minutes
Whoever invokes the Token of Peace shall not be attacked, use this to receive ${day} day of PVP protection buff
A device to locate gang hideouts in the city, you can use this item to perform a quick hideout raid.
A device to locate major gang hideouts in the city, you can use this item to perform a quick hideout raid with higher rewards.
A traditional lunar new year gift, you can open it to receive random rewards.

When used during auto gather, it will increase EXP gained by ${expPercent}% and increase the reward gained by ${rewardPercent}%
This will be consumed after one auto gather cycle
A festive cookie that looks like a cute little man.

keywords.desc: An example for an sample question
Player's main inventory
A separate inventory that player brings to adventure
A separate inventory that player stores in their apartment, can only be accessed in apartment
AFK = away from keyboard, tasks player can perform while they are not actively playing
Away from keyboard
A cool name of a bar player can visit
delivery is like item inbox, its called delivery because its in your apartment, like how you receive delivery when you order stuff online
A type of armor player can equip on their upper body
A type of armor player can equip on their lower body
Placing a bounty on another player for a hitman, synonym of "place bounty"
Dismantle an item to get components
Like a dungeon but with a sci-fi name
Player's Health, also known as HP
An attribute name
An attribute name
An attribute name
An attribute name
An attribute name added a repeat for AI to easier to understand
An attribute name added a repeat for AI to easier to understand
An attribute name added a repeat for AI to easier to understand
An attribute name added a repeat for AI to easier to understand
A job name player can perform
A job name player can perform
A job player can perform to increase their medical level, the ideal is they will do part-time job as a member of Trauma Team's extraction force, to extract VIPs from dangerous situations
Name of the game, also the name of the city set in the game, when translating this please make it sounds good, does not to be direct translation
Short-term name of the game, also the name of the city set in the game
A district area player can take control of
Like clans in other games
A cost player needs to pay to maintain their gang
A district area gang can take control of
An NPC profession name, like a cybernetic doctor
Main currency in the game, which is Eurodollars, please translate directly to Eurodollars or simply "money" if more appropriate
A fake company name, specialized in making cybernetic implants and other tech
A fake company name, specialized in making cybernetic implants and other tech
An NPC profession name, like a medical rescue team but with guns
Teams work under Trauma Team, like a medical rescue team but with guns
A team of mercenaries player can hire to help them fight
Same thing as in the Anime, when a person uses too much cybernetic ability, they will lose their mind
The attributes of items, like damage, health, armor, etc
A reward player can get from doing quests or other stuff
A process to make equipment work better
A process to make equipment work better
A process to make equipment work better, including increasing level, resetting, or adding new stats
Placing a bounty order on another player
Hacker in cyberpunk term
Hacking in cyberpunk term
Dead in cyberpunk term, will show up in the dead screen with bit writing, supposed to look cool
"Internet" in cyberpunk term
Use an item
In UI context, like a button
Block a player from sending messages to you
A bundle of items players can buy in most mobile games
A stat of equipment, a chance that players can block incoming damage
Main currency in the game, which is Eurodollars, please translate directly to Eurodollars or simply "money" if more appropriate
A note that players can find in the game and read to learn more about the game world
Referral as in referring a friend to play the game
Referral as in referring a friend to play the game
Player can scrap items from their inventory, different from dismantle, scrap will give less or no components
A generic word for 'all' in UI
A generic word for 'continue' in UI
a megacorporation that specializes in security-related tasks, they also has a hitman service where people can place hit on their enemies
A slang word for friend/bro in cyberpunk term
A uncommon container that contains a random item.
A person who has lost their mind due to excessive cybernetic implants
A mental illness caused by excessive cybernetic implants
A term used to describe cybernetic implants
Synaptic Enhancer injects nanobots into your bloodstream to enhance your intelligence and rate of learning.
Encrypted intelligence data recovered from corporate raids. Highly valuable to information brokers.
One of the npc's name in the game, does not need to be direct translation from english

A contract that provides challenging objectives with substantial rewards, reset every week based on Arclight City's dynamic geopolitical situation, offering fresh scenarios and story-driven content each time.
A division of the corporate that handles intelligence gathering and corporate espionage activities

A special credit chip that provides discounts on sale items. Expires in ${days} days.
This can be traded with Pachinko Guy
One of the npc's name in the game, does not need to be direct translation from english
The name of the news channel in the game
A key found within the dungeon that opens locked chests. Cannot be taken out of the stronghold.
ACPD investigation system access authorization. Required to submit case verdicts. Consumed upon submission regardless of outcome.
A notoriously greedy housing agency known for predatory practices and exploiting citizens in the hyper-inflated real estate market
Arclight City's primary stock exchange, facilitating trading of corporate shares and derivatives
A leading biotechnology and pharmaceutical corporation focused on genetic engineering, synthetic biology, and advanced bioware implants
The city's dominant social media platform, connecting millions through short-form posts and real-time information sharing
A controversial AI and consciousness transfer corporation specializing in recursive neural networks, synthetic companions, and digital immortality services
The city's energy infrastructure monopoly, controlling the power grid, water treatment, and waste management systems
A fanatical cult worshipping the "Goddess of Pachinko" who interpret gambling losses as tests of faith
Believers in the inevitable emergence of a god-like superintelligent AI, actively working to accelerate this event through AI development
Arclight City Police Department - A largely corrupt and brutally violent police force, often influenced or directly controlled by mega-corporations
The city's police force, known for corruption and outsourcing law enforcement through public bounties
A decentralized underground network where mercenaries trade loots and illegal items using NetCoins, run by the enigmatic Ren
Professional intermediaries who connect mercenaries with each other and broker crew formations for dangerous gigs
Numerous gangs that control territory in the lower districts and slums, often specializing in specific criminal enterprises
A mysterious, anonymous, and decentralized collective of elite hackers (Netrunners) known for sophisticated cyberattacks against corrupt mega-corporations
Body modifications that are ubiquitous in Arclight City, ranging from functional enhancements to purely aesthetic statements
Common freelance operatives hired by corporations, gangs, or individuals for tasks ranging from security to espionage and wetwork
Short form of mercenary, common freelance operatives in Arclight City
A job or mission, typically for a mercenary
Corporate employee or related to corporations, often used derisively
Idiot, fool - cyberpunk slang
Premium, top-quality, excellent - cyberpunk slang
Cyberware, or generally, anything high-tech and shiny - cyberpunk slang
Killed - cyberpunk slang
A powerful, semi-autonomous state within the American Federation that covers much of the former US West Coast
Abbreviation for New Republic of California
The volatile and fractured successor to the former United States, an unstable patchwork of bickering states and corporate-run zones
Abbreviation for American Federation
A strategic alliance between the mainland continental power and Russia, engaged in tense cold war with the American Federation
Abbreviation for Eastern Continental Alliance
A vast, technologically dominant economic bloc stretching across much of East Asia and Oceania
Abbreviation for Pan-Asian Cooperative
Controlling most of Western and Central Europe, a heavily fortified and bureaucratic super-state focused on internal stability and defense
Abbreviation for European Federation
A coalition led by Iran including several Middle Eastern nations that survived The Collapse by leveraging their energy resources
Abbreviation for Persian Gulf Consortium
A techno-corporate state that leveraged technological expertise to become a major player in cybersecurity, AI development, and military technology
Abbreviation for Israeli Tech Republic
A tenacious investigative journalist for Arclight Times, known for his deeply researched exposés with the catchphrase: "The data doesn't lie, people do."
A precise, objective data journalist for Arclight Times who specializes in data-driven analysis and quantitative reporting
An immersive, narrative-driven journalist for Arclight Times who focuses on street-level stories from the Lower Districts, known for: "Every augment tells a story..."
A high-level strategic reporter for Arclight Times with a background in global threat analysis, focusing on geopolitical and corporate power dynamics
A leading biotechnology and pharmaceutical corporation focused on genetic engineering, synthetic biology, and advanced bioware implants
A premium Christmas container reserved for the most valuable rewards. Only the worthy receive Noel's elite gifts.
A tactical key required to unlock Noel's Elite Crate. Only available from Noel herself.
A token that can be used to unlock a Christmas container.
One of the npc's name in the game, does not need to be direct translation from english
A weekly cooperative gang operation where players breach megacorporation security systems
A consumable item required to participate in NetRun operations, consumed on each attempt regardless of success
The puzzle minigame in NetRun where players rotate nodes to connect power from start to end
Individual milestones in NetRun based on player's contribution points
Collective goals in NetRun that unlock when everyone's combined contributions reach certain thresholds
One of the npc's name in the game, does not need to be direct translation from english
